Each measure used in the MWI Tool was assessed based on its strengths, limitations, and theoretical justification for inclusion into the tool. Detailed documentation for each measure can be accessed below.

### Social Determinants of Health

| Alcohol Outlet Density                                                                                                                      | Number of places that sell alcohol per 10,000 people. |                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Studies on alcohol outlets have found an association between higher alcohol outlet density and adverse mental health outcomes.[^1] [^2]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| Broadband Access                                                                                                                            | Percent of families in a community who own a computer and have internet at home.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/house-signal.svg" width="50" height="50"/>              | ***Why is "Broadband Access" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Access to reliable, high-speed broadband internet can increase access to healthcare resources including mental health and substance use providers through telehealth services. Access to broadband internet can also serve as a resource to find local mental health providers and resources. Additionally, broadband internet has become an important social determinant of health in communities.[^3] In addition to providing access to health resources, it enhances access to opportunities (educational and employment among others), impacting overall socioeconomic status and community well-being.[^4] [^5] [^6] |

|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Living close to natural areas, such as parks, can have benefits on mental health.[^7] [^8] Studies have found that living within short walking distance of a park has a positive impact on mental health. [^9]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |

|                                                                                                                                             | ##### Education Success                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| No High School Diploma                                                                                                                      | Percent of adults who are 25 or older who have not graduated from high school.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/graduation-cap.svg" width="50" height="50"/>            | ***Why is "No High School Diploma" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Studies have found teenagers with a mental health disorder are at higher risk of dropping out of school before graduation.[^10] At the same time, those without a high school degree are less likely to seek medical care for mental health conditions.[^11] Studies have shown that strategies that focus on education can help to prevent and reduce health disparities.[^12]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Click [here](https://github.com/mitre/hse-mwi/blob/main/Documentation/Measures/No_High_School_Diploma.pdf?raw=true){target="_blank"} to learn more about this measure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Stratified:** Yes                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Data Source:** American Community Survey (ACS)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Year(s):** 2017 - 2021 (ACS 5-year estimates)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Nursery and Preschool Enrollment                                                                                                            | Percent of children enrolled in nursery school or pre-school.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/child-reaching.svg" width="50" height="50"/>            | ***Why is "Nursery and Preschool Enrollment" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Early Childhood Education provides an opportunity for early detection of mental and developmental issues in children. It also supports the development of important mental skills.[^13] In the long-term, it has been shown to improve high school completion rates and to lower rates of involvement with the criminal justice system, both of which are associated with better mental health outcomes.[^14]                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Aside from children, parents also benefit from Early Childhood Education. When a parent has access to childcare they have more time to take care of themselves and their household, which cultivates an environment in which children can thrive.[^15]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Click [here](https://github.com/mitre/hse-mwi/blob/main/Documentation/Measures/Nursery_and_Preschool_Enrollment.pdf?raw=true){target="_blank"} to learn more about this measure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Stratified:** Yes                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Data Source:** American Community Survey (ACS)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

|                                                                                                                                             | ##### Income and Employment                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Below 100% Federal Poverty Level                                                                                                            | Percent of people with an annual income lower than what is defined as the 100% federal poverty level. The federal poverty level is an income number based on family income and number of individuals per family.[^16]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/person-arrow-up-from-line.svg" width="50" height="50"/> | ***Why is "Poverty Level" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Having lower levels of income is associated with a high possibility of mood disorders, substance use disorders, and suicide attempts.[^17] Adults with an income lower than the federal poverty level report higher rates of mental distress than do adults in higher income households.[^18] At the same time, people with mental illness are at higher risk of living in poverty.[^19]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Click [here](https://github.com/mitre/hse-mwi/blob/main/Documentation/Measures/Below_100_Federal_Poverty_Level.pdf?raw=true){target="_blank"} to learn more about this measure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Stratified:** Yes                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Data Source:** American Community Survey (ACS)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Year(s):** 2017 - 2021 (ACS 5-year estimates)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Unemployment                                                                                                                                | Percent of people who are unemployed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/sack-xmark.svg" width="50" height="50"/>                | ***Why is "Unemployment" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Unemployment impacts the ability to afford and access healthcare, health insurance, and engaging in activities that promote health. Unemployment is also related to higher rates of suicide, depression, anxiety, and psychological stress.[^20]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Click [here](https://github.com/mitre/hse-mwi/blob/main/Documentation/Measures/Unemployment.pdf?raw=true){target="_blank"} to learn more about this measure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |

|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

|                                                                                                                                             | ##### Housing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Housing Stress                                                                                                                              | Percent of families who are experiencing one or more the following situations:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/house.svg" width="50" height="50"/>                     | -   More than 30% of the family income is going towards paying for monthly housing costs, including utilities,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | -   Family members are sharing bedrooms,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | -   Lack necessary bathroom facilities (e.g., a sink)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | -   Lack essential kitchen facilities (e.g., a fridge).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | ***Why is "Housing Stress" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Living in a physical space that lacks the main necessities can increase stress, anxiety, and depression levels.[^21] At the same time, high costs of utilities and other housing costs means having fewer financial resources to cover other mental health needs such as medications, treatments, and medical visits.[^22]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Click [here](https://github.com/mitre/hse-mwi/blob/main/Documentation/Measures/Housing_Stress.pdf?raw=true){target="_blank"} to learn more about this measure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Stratified:** Yes                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Data Source:** Housing and Urban Development (HUD) Consolidated Planning/Comprehensive Housing Affordability Strategy (CHAS)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | **Year(s):** 2015 - 2019                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |

| Residential Segregation                                                                                                                     | Measures economic and racial/ethnic differences by locations. Provides a view of where low-income and minority groups are located compared to high-income groups.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/people-arrows.svg" width="50" height="50"/>             | ***Why is "Residential Segregation" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Poverty and socioeconomic differences have an impact on mental health.[^23] Exploring residential segregation is essential to understanding the effect of structural racism on population mental health.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

|                                                                                                                                             | ##### Social Capital                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Third Places                                                                                                                                | The term "third places" refers to places where people spend time outside of their home ("first place") and their work ("second place"). Some of these may include botanical gardens, museums, libraries, coffee shops, video arcades, markets, restaurants, etc. This measure provides the number of "third places" in a specific location per 100,000 people.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/solid/map-location-dot.svg" width="50" height="50"/>          | ***Why is a measure of "Third Places" important when we think about mental wellness?***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | The presence of third places in a community has been linked to people feeling they have a better quality of life.[^24] Having access to a variety of types of third places (such as coffee shops, video arcades, markets, restaurants, and religious institutions) can help promote positive behaviors and mental health wellness.[^25] [^26] [^27] Having access to cultural-specific places can promote cultural integration and support mental wellness.[^28]                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                             | Click [here](https://github.com/mitre/hse-mwi/blob/main/Documentation/Measures/Third_Places.pdf?raw=true){target="_blank"} to learn more about this measure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
